intro: Dugandiodendron colombianum, commonly known as the Colombian yellowwood, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically blooming in the spring. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats within montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
